All Games > Indie Games > Pressured
Community Hub
Pressured
Pressured is a unique and intense number puzzler. Hit your targets to unlock pieces of the dark story, all told via the poetry of Nicholas Gordon. Created by Paul Marrable With music from Matt Mcfarland.
User reviews: Mixed (356 reviews) - 54% of the 356 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: Jul 18, 2014

Feature List

-Easy to learn but hard to master gameplay
-3 levels of difficulty to unlock
-Works great with touch screen monitors or with a mouse
-Simple pick up and play mechanics
-Intriguing dark story told through unlocked poems
-Includes Steam trading cards

READ MORE

About This Game

Pressured is a unique and intense number puzzler. Hit your targets to unlock pieces of the dark story, all told via the poetry of Nicholas Gordon.
You'll need a combination of quick thinking and sharp reflexes if you don't want to succumb to the pressure.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP
    • Processor: 1.2 Ghz
    • Memory: 512 MB RAM
    • Graphics: Shader Model 1.1 compatible graphics card
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 80 MB available space
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 7
    • Processor: 3 Ghz
    • Memory: 1 GB RAM
    • Graphics: Shader Model 2.0 compatible graphics card
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 100 MB available space

somesum

38 reviews
Not Recommended
2.2 hrs on record
Posted: July 3
Take a good hard look at the screenshots for this game before purchasing. Some games deliberately go for a retro look and feel this one just seems unpolished and rushed.
The game itself is simple maths against a clock. I did not find it addictive and lost interest quickly.

Posted: June 16
This game will literally sometimes bar you from getting certain numbers. The numbers already switch fast enough, but to stop you from finishing the sum you want, in addition to inconsistant bomb placement, is really annoying.
